document.masterDocTitle: Survey Of Phytoseiid Mite Species (Acari: Phytoseiidae) In Citrus Orchards In Lattakia Governorate, Syria

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Survey Of Phytoseiid Mite Species (Acari: Phytoseiidae) In Citrus Orchards In Lattakia Governorate, Syria

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Euseius stipulatus ( Athias-Henriot, 1960a )
Amblyseius stipulatus Athias-Henriot, 1960a: 294
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimens collected — 198 ♀ on
Citrus sp.
and 42 ♀ on eight host plants in different sites in 2011 and 2012 ( Tables 1 and 2 ).

Female — Specimens measured: 20 ♀ from
Citrus sp.
, Al-Sanobar, 05 May 2011 .

Dorsum — Dorsal shield smooth, with five pairs of solenostomes (gd2, gd4" duplicate",gd6, gd8 and gd9), 367 (360 – 375) long and 241 (230 – 250) at level of setaej6; j1 35 (33 – 38), j3 41 (38 – 45), j4 16 (15 – 17), j5 15 (13 – 17), j6 15 (13 – 15), J2 17 (15 – 18), J5 8, z2 18 (18 – 20), z4 29 (28 – 30), z5 13 (13 – 15), Z1 17 (15 – 18), Z4 20 (17 – 20), Z5 63 (60 – 68), s4 42 (40 – 43), S2 23 , S4 27 (25 – 28), S5 27 (25 – 28),
r3 18 (18 – 20), R1 15. All dorsal setae smooth, except Z5,which is slightly serrate
.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 2: Number of specimens of Phytoseiidae species found on citrus and wild plants at the different locations considered in Lattakia governate (Syria) in 2011 and 2012.

tr.th: Phytoseiid mite species (No. of specimens per plant)

subSubSection.paragraph: Peritreme — Extending to level of setae j3.

Venter — Sternal shield with three pairs of setae (St1, St2 and St3); distances between St1-St1 62 (58 – 65), St2-St2 70 (68 – 73), St3-St3 88 (88 – 90), St1- St3 64 (63 – 65), St4-St4 110 (108 – 115). Distance between genital setae St5-St5 79 (75 – 84).Ventrianal shield 113 (110 – 115) long, 60 (58 – 63) wide at level of ZV2 and 79 (78 – 80) wide at level of anus, with three pairs of preanal setae and a pair of large pores posteromesad to JV2; JV5 39 (35 – 43).
Chelicera — Fixed digit 25 long, tridentate; movable digit 23 long, unidentate.
Spermatheca — Calyx tubular, 20 long, parallel sides; atrium prominent, attached directly to calyx.
Legs — SgeII 25, SgeIII 27, StiIII 26 (25 – 28), SgeIV 35 (32 – 37), StiIV 28 (27 – 30), StIV 56 (55 – 60).

Specimens collected — Al-ya’robiyah: 10 ♀ on
Citrus sp.
, 27 April 2011 . Al-Sanobar: 3 ♀ on
Citrus sp.
, 05 May 2011 . Al-Shir: 11 ♀ on
Citrus sp.
, 05 May 2011 . Karsana: 8 ♀ on
Citrus sp.
and 2 ♀ on
Malva sylvestris
, 05 May 2011 ( Tables 1 and 2 ).

Female — Specimens measured: 20 ♀ from
Citrus sp.
, Al-ya’robiyah, 27 April 2011 , and Al-Shir, 05 May 2011 .
Peritreme — Extending to level between setae z2 and z4.

Venter — Sternal shield with three pairs of setae (St1, St2 and St3); distances between St1-St1 67 (65 – 68), St2-St2 74 (70 – 75), St3-St3 89 (85 – 90), St1- St3 67 (65 – 68), St4-St4 112 (109 – 115). Distance between genital setae St5-St5 83 (80 – 88). Ventrianal shield 95 (93 – 103) long, 65 (63 – 68) wide at level of ZV2 and 67 (63 – 75) wide at level of anus, with three pairs of setae and a pair of large pores posteromesad to JV2; JV5 45 (43 – 53).
Chelicera — Fixed digit 25 long, with two prominent and apical teeth, and four minute teeth clustered midway along digit; movable digit 23 long, unidentate.
Spermatheca — Calyx elongate, narrow flaring towards vesicle, 37 long.
Legs — SgeII 27, SgeIII 39 (38 – 40), StiIII 31 (30 – 32), SgeIV 62, StiIV 47 (45 – 50), StIV 81 (78 – 85).
